result.execSummary:
The defendant Russel S. SLIWINSKI was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: consecutive to the Sheboygan County sentence 16 CF 331.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
AODA assessment and follow through counseling.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Have no contact with Karen and Randel Leifer or the residence of 851 N. 18th Street, Manitowoc, WI  54220.

Defendant in custody on warrant and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  $1,000.00 recognizance bond previously furnished is continued by the Court with the same conditions.  Preliminary Hearing set for 02-24-2016 at 1:30 p.m., Br. 2.  (Notice given to defendant.)

Heather Richmond, Public Defender.

Defendant in custody.   
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.    Preliminary hearing is set for 02-10-16 at 1:30 p.m.   
Minutes.
RE:  Floyd Heth, Jr., on 01-11-16.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of burglary.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 02-01-16 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $1,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he report to the Two Rivers City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release and have no contact with Floyd Heth, Jr. or his residence at 1608 19th Street, Two Rivers, WI.   Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.
